diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Perforated diverticulitis with sepsis, acute kidney injury, ischemic sigmoid colostomy, open abdomen secondary to diverticulitis and sepsis, acute fatty liver
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting, and diarrhea. A CT scan showed free air, indicating perforation. Surgical findings during exploratory laparotomy confirmed a perforated sigmoid colon with fibrinous exudate, suggesting a longstanding process. Postoperative complications included persistent acidosis and hypotension.
